p: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), including fatty liver, liver fibrosis, and cirrhosis, have been known as common consequences of diabetes (Lankarani et al., 2013; Bellentani et al., 2010). Many rodent models of type 1 and type 2 diabetes have been established to explain the pathogenesis of diabetes and to test novel therapies for the suppression of complications of diabetes (King, 2012; Liang et al., 2015). Streptozotocin (STZ), a glucosamine‐nitrosourea compound, is used to induce diabetes in experimental animals (Noshahr et al., 2020; Rahman et al., 2018). STZ by the induction of oxidative stress and lipid peroxidation damages the pancreatic beta cells and impairs insulin production (Ghasemi et al., 2014).
